body.p: Mitral valve stenosis would most directly lead to __________.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The mitral valve separates the chambers on the left side of the heart, so the most direct effects are there.
Incorrect. The main effects of mitral valve stenosis occur on the left side of the heart.

Correct. The narrowing of the mitral valve makes it harder to push blood from the left atrium into the left ventricle. This causes left atrial pressure to increase to compensate for the increased resistance across the valve.
Incorrect. Because the left ventricle is distal (after) the narrowed mitral valve, this is not where the pressure increases. The pressure needs to be higher proximal to the narrowed valve.
